text: Park City is a city in Utah in the United States. It was settled by Mormons in the 1840s and 1850s. There was a lot of mining there in the 1860s. Today, it has many ski resorts. Park City has 8,396 people, as of 2020. It is at an elevation of 7,000 feet. It is where the Sundance Film Festival takes place. Some of the events of the 2002 Winter Olympics were held in or near Park City. ==References== Category:Ski areas and resorts in the United States Category:19th-century establishments in Utah
title: Park City, Utah
